title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB:
- When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
- The text file is marked as a dirty file.
- Left clicking on the Windows Start menu and selecting the 'Shut Down...' command immediately shuts down/reboots the computer without any warning or question message box.
EB:
- A dialog box should be provided with the message 'Do you want to save your file?' with options 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' (which halts the shutdown).
- It would be nice to allow the applications to control the shutdown/save or to pop up their own windows that would also allow the user to stop the shutdown if 'Cancel' is selected.
SR:
1. Open WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to shutdown/reboot the computer.
5. Verify that there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty file(s) and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.
